TypeSignature.Value: .class public interface auto ansi abstract IInputMethodSession implements class Android.Runtime.IJavaObject, class System.IDisposable

Docs.summary: The InputMethodSession interface provides the per-client functionality of that is safe to expose to applications.

remarks.para: The InputMethodSession interface provides the per-client functionality of that is safe to expose to applications.
Applications will not normally use this interface themselves, instead relying on the standard interaction provided by and .

MemberSignature.Value: public void AppPrivateCommand (string action, Android.OS.Bundle data);
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void AppPrivateCommand(string action, class Android.OS.Bundle data) cil managed

Docs.param: Name of the command to be performed. This must be a scoped name, i.e. prefixed with a package name you own, so that different developers will not create conflicting commands.
Any data to include with the command.
Docs.summary: Process a private command sent from the application to the input method.

remarks.para: Process a private command sent from the application to the input method. This can be used to provide domain-specific features that are only known between certain input methods and their clients.

MemberSignature.Value: public void DispatchGenericMotionEvent (int seq, Android.Views.MotionEvent e, Android.Views.InputMethods.IInputMethodSessionEventCallback callback);

.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void DispatchGenericMotionEvent(int32 seq, class Android.Views.MotionEvent e, class Android.Views.InputMethods.IInputMethodSessionEventCallback callback) cil managed

Docs.param: To be added.
The motion event.
To be added.
Docs.summary: This method is called when there is a generic motion event.

remarks.para: This method is called when there is a generic motion event.
If the input method wants to handle this event, return true, otherwise return false and the caller (i.e. the application) will handle the event.

MemberSignature.Value: public void DispatchKeyEvent (int seq, Android.Views.KeyEvent e, Android.Views.InputMethods.IInputMethodSessionEventCallback callback);

.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void DispatchKeyEvent(int32 seq, class Android.Views.KeyEvent e, class Android.Views.InputMethods.IInputMethodSessionEventCallback callback) cil managed

Docs.param: To be added.
The key event.
To be added.
Docs.summary: This method is called when a key is pressed.

remarks.para: This method is called when a key is pressed. When done with the event, the implementation must call back on callback with its result.
If the input method wants to handle this event, return true, otherwise return false and the caller (i.e. the application) will handle the event.

Docs.param: To be added.
The motion event.
To be added.
Docs.summary: This method is called when there is a track ball event.

remarks.para: This method is called when there is a track ball event.
If the input method wants to handle this event, return true, otherwise return false and the caller (i.e. the application) will handle the event.

MemberSignature.Value: public void DisplayCompletions (Android.Views.InputMethods.CompletionInfo[] completions);
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void DisplayCompletions(class Android.Views.InputMethods.CompletionInfo[] completions) cil managed

Docs.param: Array of text completions that are available, starting with the best. If this array is null, any existing completions will be removed.
Docs.summary: Called by a text editor that performs auto completion, to tell the input method about the completions it has available.

remarks.para: Called by a text editor that performs auto completion, to tell the input method about the completions it has available. This can be used by the input method to display them to the user to select the text to be inserted.

MemberSignature.Value: public void FinishInput ();
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void FinishInput() cil managed

Docs.summary: This method is called when the application would like to stop receiving text input.

remarks.para: This method is called when the application would like to stop receiving text input.

MemberSignature.Value: public void ToggleSoftInput (Android.Views.InputMethods.ShowFlags showFlags, Android.Views.InputMethods.HideSoftInputFlags hideFlags);

.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void ToggleSoftInput(valuetype Android.Views.InputMethods.ShowFlags showFlags, valuetype Android.Views.InputMethods.HideSoftInputFlags hideFlags) cil managed

Docs.param: Provides additional operating flags. May be 0 or have the , bit set.
Provides additional operating flags. May be 0 or have the , bit set.

remarks.para: Toggle the soft input window. Applications can toggle the state of the soft input window.

MemberSignature.Value: public void UpdateCursor (Android.Graphics.Rect newCursor);
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void UpdateCursor(class Android.Graphics.Rect newCursor) cil managed

Docs.param: The rectangle of the cursor currently being shown in the input field's window coordinates.
Docs.summary: This method is called when cursor location of the target input field has changed within its window.

remarks.para: This method is called when cursor location of the target input field has changed within its window. This is not normally called, but will only be reported if requested by the input method.

MemberSignature.Value: public void UpdateCursorAnchorInfo (Android.Views.InputMethods.CursorAnchorInfo cursorAnchorInfo);
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void UpdateCursorAnchorInfo(class Android.Views.InputMethods.CursorAnchorInfo cursorAnchorInfo) cil managed

Docs.param: Positional information relevant to text input, such as text insertion point and composition string.
Docs.summary: This method is called when the cursor and/or the character position relevant to text input is changed on the screen.

remarks.para: This method is called when the cursor and/or the character position relevant to text input is changed on the screen. This is not called by default. It will only be reported if requested by the input method.

MemberSignature.Value: public void UpdateExtractedText (int token, Android.Views.InputMethods.ExtractedText text);
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void UpdateExtractedText(int32 token, class Android.Views.InputMethods.ExtractedText text) cil managed

Docs.param: The input method supplied token for identifying its request.
The new extracted text.
Docs.summary: Called by a text editor to report its new extracted text when its contents change.

remarks.para: Called by a text editor to report its new extracted text when its contents change. This will only be called if the input method calls with the option to report updates.

Docs.param: The previous text offset of the cursor selection start position.
The previous text offset of the cursor selection end position.
The new text offset of the cursor selection start position.
The new text offset of the cursor selection end position.
The text offset of the current candidate text start position.
The text offset of the current candidate text end position.
Docs.summary: This method is called when the selection or cursor in the current target input field has changed.

remarks.para: This method is called when the selection or cursor in the current target input field has changed.

MemberSignature.Value: public void ViewClicked (bool focusChanged);
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void ViewClicked(bool focusChanged) cil managed

Docs.param: true if the user changed the focused view by this click.
Docs.summary: This method is called when the user tapped a text view.

remarks.para: This method is called when the user tapped a text view. IMEs can't rely on this method being called because this was not part of the original IME protocol, so applications with custom text editing written before this method appeared will not call to inform the IME of this interaction.
